Fake setTimeout and friends (collectively known as "timers"). Useful in your JavaScript tests. Extracted from Sinon.JS

commit_list.message:
Check for existence of `process` before using it

This fixes a bug where Lolex would no longer work in browsers because `process` doesn't exist.
commit_list.repo_description: Fake setTimeout and friends (collectively known as "timers"). Useful in your JavaScript tests. Extracted from Sinon.JS

commit_list.message:
Run to last existing timer

Add the ability to run to the last currently scheduled timer.

https://github.com/sinonjs/lolex/issues/44

This is useful when you want to run a test to completion, but the test recursively sets timers that would cause `runAll` to trigger an infinite loop warning.
commit_list.repo_description: Fake setTimeout and friends (collectively known as "timers"). Useful in your JavaScript tests. Extracted from Sinon.JS

commit_list.message:
Add runAll method to run timers until empty

https://github.com/sinonjs/lolex/issues/44

This runs all pending timers until there are none remaining. If new timers are added while it is executing they will be run as well.

This makes it easier to run asynchronous tests to completion without worrying about the number of timers they use, or the delays in those timers.

It runs a maximum of `loopLimit` times after which it assumes there is an infinite loop of timers and throws an error.
commit_list.repo_description: Fake setTimeout and friends (collectively known as "timers"). Useful in your JavaScript tests. Extracted from Sinon.JS

commit_list.message: Make everything a little less ugly!
Bootstrap is now run through the Webpack build
Integrate Karma, Mocha, and PhantomJS for unit testing
Add a link to the Demo
Readme now explains how to get the project up and running
Deploy now works with ignored files

Show the correct watchers count

We request each repository from the GitHub API individually to get the `subscriber_count` field.

This is the actual watchers count (the `watchers_count` field is actually the number of users who have starred the repository).

More Webpack Goodness!

* Notifications on builds/failures
* Auto reload page on any changes
* Require .less/.css files and build into a separate .css file
* Lint .coffee files
* Require .coffee files without needing an extension

Watchers is actually called subscribers in the API

And the API doesn't return this when listing a users repositories with `/user/:name/repos` or from the search API.

So we'll need to load each repository individually to pull through this data!
Use search API to get automatic sorting.
Add script to deploy to GitHub pages.
Move HTML to dist folder for use with GitHub pages.

You can now update config

This is the beginning of an example of how to modify state from deep within the Component heirarchy.
Tweak title and add basic docs.

Fix typo and grammar.

Just a quick fix for a misspelling of 'change', and I also tidied it up to read a little better.
Trying to get code working again.
Tidy up code to vaguely work again.
Slight tidy of week creator (spliting into multiple functions).
Events ends can no longer be left half way through a day when resizing.
Events no longer stay editing when you click to edit a second event.
Deleting events now display in faded manner.
Slight tidying of drag and resize handling.

Minor tidy up.
Now passes Javascript lint.
Update and error images now shown within events.
Calendar now remembers cookie across browser sessions.
Refactored googleEvent references to the single google-event-loader class.
Tidy up CoffeeScript at little more.
Use list comprehensions instead of while loops where possible.

Notifications now show again when scrolling.
Dragging the calendar to scroll now works again.
Move last file over to coffeescript.
Day numbers and day highlight now work again.
Multiday events that don't span weeks can now be more than one row high.
First attempt at moving events between calendars.
Fix bug where editing an event while a new event is being saved, causes the new event's text to show up as 'New Event...' again.

Important events now have a golden glow.
Month label no lines up better.
New events are now editable again :)
Disabled editing for calendars you can't edit.
Drag and resize now work in Chrome.
Try live updating of drag and drop.
You can now drag the calendar to scroll (ala a PDF)

Switch to jquery 1.4
You can now scroll upwards in Chrome (scrolling may still be erratic)
Hacking in drag and drop functionality.

Possible fix for display error on first load.
Convert all console.log statements to $.log
Initial attempt at drag and drop.

Add keyboard navigation of scrolling (up + down arrows, and page up + down).
Press 't' to go to today.
Remove unused javascript file.
Updated TODO.
Add opacity CSS rules for IE 8.

Refresh events after editing.
For now, the updating indicator no longer shows.

Events are now deleted if they contain no text, or only white space.
You can now press enter to save and edit, and Esc to cancel.
Newly created events are now added to the cache, so refreshing the week no longer makes them disappear.

Refactored out week creator and day highlighter into separate classes.
Moving towards adding the ability to create events.
First version of event editing, with update indicator.
Refactor out event creation into it's own class.

Started adding PHP Unit testing.
Refactored update script into two classes.

commit_list.message:
* CoffeeScript runner now looks for directories matching  'coffee-*' and compiles the coffeescript into the directory matching the * part. e.g. if a directory /tests/coffee-spec/ is found then the coffeescript files within it are compiled to /tests/spec/

* Added Jasmine node runner. This allows us to run jasmine tests within Node.js and avoid the overhead of starting a browser. Still needs a little more work to provide a nice way to require large numbers of files in the case when you need to include a large library of files.

Merge pull request #15 from karl/greenkeeper/default/webpack-dev-server-3.1.5

Update webpack-dev-server in group default to the latest version 🚀
Another attempt at fixing greenkeeper lockfile

feat(release): Try using Semantic Release (#16)

* Semantic Release

* Fix circleci config

* Lint and test example

* Try fixing build

Merge pull request #12 from karl/greenkeeper/default/tslint-config-prettier-1.14.0

Update tslint-config-prettier in group default to the latest version 🚀

Merge pull request #11 from karl/greenkeeper/default/webpack-4.16.1

chore(package): update webpack to version 4.16.1
Descriptions are now JS to support function conditions
feat: Only deploy on master, and try to fix deploy

feat(release): GitHub no strict host key check (#18)

* Try and avoid host key checking for GitHub

* .
feat(release): Try and fix semantic release

Position JSX whitespace (`{" "}`) at the end of lines (#1964)

* Position JSX whitespace at the end of lines

Currently we place JSX whitespace at the beginning of lines.

* Use `isLiteral` when determining JSX whitespace

JSX whitespace on the same line as text (#1829)

This tweaks our JSX formatting to only put a JSX whitespace `{" "}` on a line by itself when it comes before or after a multiline element.

When preceding a text or single line element it appear on the same line as that element.

Fix unstable JSX output by ensuring we follow `fill` rules. (#1827)

* Fix unstable JSX output by ensuring we follow `fill` rules.

This changes makes us more strict about ensuring our JSX children follow the alternating content/whitespace format expected by the `fill` primitive.

Previously there were some cases where could get out of sync which would throw out the formatting.

* Simplify whitespace wrangling

# Conflicts:
#	src/printer.js

Hug JSX text after multi line tags (#1671)

* Hug JSX text after multi line tags

* Hug text to beginning of tags

Preserve unusual unicode whitespace (#1658)

* Keep unusual unicode spaces

This no longer converts unusual unicode whitespace characters (such as a non-breaking space) into normal spaces.

* Tweak comment based on PR feedback
Fix fill wrapping when text starts with whitespace (#1666)

New primitive to fill a line with as many doc parts as possible (#1120)

* Add new fill primitive and use it to wrap text in JSX

This adds a new `fill` primitive that can be used to fill lines with as much code as possible before moving to a new line with the same indentation.

It is used here layout JSX children. This gives us nicer wrapping for JSX elements containings lots of text interspersed with tags.

* Quick fix for jsx whitespace regressions

* Fix a couple more bugs

* Tidy up the `fill` algorithm

Attempt to make the algorithm a little more regular, and improve the naming of variables to make it a little easier to understand (I hope!).

* Small tidy up of JSX whitespace declarations

* Remove unnecessary code

It turns out that `children` is only used in the case when the element is printed on a single line, in which case all the types of JSX whitespaces behave the same, so we don't need to special case leading/trailing/solitary whitespace.

* A little more tidy up based on PR feedback

* Fix up tests after rebasing

* Make it explicit that we keep multiple consecutive spaces

* Add an explanatory comment

* Fix broken snapshot in master

* Ignore existing commands when deciding whether content will fit when using fill

* Fix a bug where children would get incorrectly filled onto a line

* Tidy up JSX whitespace names
Add doc debug printing for line-suffix-boundary (#1158)

Do not break long `describe` calls (#953)

This ensures that `describe` calls in test suites are whitelisted in the same way as `it` and `test` and never break across lines.
Add Jest and use Babel with Rollup
Type definitions seem to be working.

Remove example as it was messing with Jest
Try a newer version of node
Fix typescript errors and update snapshots

Mad scientist idea of having our own limited saga runner
Avoid mad scientist stuff and stop typescript complaining
Start working on debug and actions
We have a working state machine!
Partial support for nested state machines
Work in progress support for parallel states
Test out state machine cat beta with label support
Extract state machine test descriptions to json files
Add lerna for ease of publishing
Handle initial states inside nested state machines
Update state machine cat and pin deps

Use state machine cat json representation
Use state machine cat json representation
Don't actually publish from dev machine

Handle guards
Use `yarn start` instead of `yarn run dev`

feat: Support `onEntry` for initial state (#32)

* Fix up yarn.lock and visualisation that were out of date!

* Add support for initial onEntry

* Don't toString functions!

* Update Readme
no-deploy: Only deploy the master branch
Don't run untagged for all branches

Don't deploy on version updates

This should stop infinite deploys on CI!
no-deploy: Add link to deployed version of example

no-deploy: Tidy up (#29)

* Remove unused greenkeeper file

* Update Readme and add start & test

* update example visualisation

feat: Add support for initial activities (#31)

* Add support for initial activities

* Add a second example state machine

Pull colours for kuker from a pastel palette

* Play around with Kuker dev tools

* Try fixing up tests

* Fix build

And add build for example

no-deploy: CircleCI test results (#35)

* Output test results for Circle CI

* Fix yaml
no-deploy: Fail the build if the lockfile is out of date (#36)

Fail CI if visualisation are not up to date (#37)

* Fail if visualisations are not up to date

* And bring visualisation up to date!

feat: Handle initial and nested states (#42)

* Handle initital and nested states

* Fix up Typescript errors
Trying to get code working again.
Tidy up code to vaguely work again.
Slight tidy of week creator (spliting into multiple functions).
Events ends can no longer be left half way through a day when resizing.
Events no longer stay editing when you click to edit a second event.
Deleting events now display in faded manner.
Slight tidying of drag and resize handling.

Minor tidy up.
Now passes Javascript lint.
Update and error images now shown within events.
Calendar now remembers cookie across browser sessions.
Refactored googleEvent references to the single google-event-loader class.
Tidy up CoffeeScript at little more.
Use list comprehensions instead of while loops where possible.

Notifications now show again when scrolling.
Dragging the calendar to scroll now works again.
Move last file over to coffeescript.
Day numbers and day highlight now work again.
Multiday events that don't span weeks can now be more than one row high.
First attempt at moving events between calendars.
Fix bug where editing an event while a new event is being saved, causes the new event's text to show up as 'New Event...' again.

Important events now have a golden glow.
Month label no lines up better.
New events are now editable again :)
Disabled editing for calendars you can't edit.
Drag and resize now work in Chrome.
Try live updating of drag and drop.
You can now drag the calendar to scroll (ala a PDF)

Switch to jquery 1.4
You can now scroll upwards in Chrome (scrolling may still be erratic)
Hacking in drag and drop functionality.

Possible fix for display error on first load.
Convert all console.log statements to $.log
Initial attempt at drag and drop.

Add keyboard navigation of scrolling (up + down arrows, and page up + down).
Press 't' to go to today.
Remove unused javascript file.
Updated TODO.
Add opacity CSS rules for IE 8.

Refresh events after editing.
For now, the updating indicator no longer shows.

Events are now deleted if they contain no text, or only white space.
You can now press enter to save and edit, and Esc to cancel.
Newly created events are now added to the cache, so refreshing the week no longer makes them disappear.

Refactored out week creator and day highlighter into separate classes.
Moving towards adding the ability to create events.
First version of event editing, with update indicator.
Refactor out event creation into it's own class.

commit_list.repo_description: Prettier is an opinionated code formatter.

commit_list.message:
New primitive to fill a line with as many doc parts as possible (#1120)

* Add new fill primitive and use it to wrap text in JSX

This adds a new `fill` primitive that can be used to fill lines with as much code as possible before moving to a new line with the same indentation.

It is used here layout JSX children. This gives us nicer wrapping for JSX elements containings lots of text interspersed with tags.

* Quick fix for jsx whitespace regressions

* Fix a couple more bugs

* Tidy up the `fill` algorithm

Attempt to make the algorithm a little more regular, and improve the naming of variables to make it a little easier to understand (I hope!).

* Small tidy up of JSX whitespace declarations

* Remove unnecessary code

It turns out that `children` is only used in the case when the element is printed on a single line, in which case all the types of JSX whitespaces behave the same, so we don't need to special case leading/trailing/solitary whitespace.

* A little more tidy up based on PR feedback

* Fix up tests after rebasing

* Make it explicit that we keep multiple consecutive spaces

* Add an explanatory comment

* Fix broken snapshot in master

* Ignore existing commands when deciding whether content will fit when using fill

* Fix a bug where children would get incorrectly filled onto a line

* Tidy up JSX whitespace names
commit_list.repo_description: Prettier is an opinionated code formatter.
